msDesc.head: NICHOLAS DE LYRA; S. XIV ex.

msItem.author: NICHOLAS DE LYRA
msItem.title: Commentaries on Luke, John, Matthew, Mark, Pauline Epistles, Acts, Canonical Epistles, Apocalypse
msItem.incipit: Incipit euuangelium beati Luce euuangeliste. Facies bouis a sinistris ipsorum quattuor. Sicut dictum fuit in principio euuangelii secundum Mattheum Ezechiele propheta in uisione animalium

(fol. 28v) Facies aquile desuper ipsorum quatuor Ezechiel. primo. Ezechiel propheta aperti sunt celi ...; Hic est Iohannes. Huic euuangelio quod est ceteris perfectius ...; In principio erat uerbum. Secundum quod patet ex predictis intentio beati Iohannis est diuinitatem Domini nostri Iesu Christi spiritualiter declarare

(fol. 80) Quatuor facies uni Eze. 1. Secundum quod scribit beatus Gregorius super Ezechielem prima parte omelia iii ...; Matheus &c. Hic est primus prologus beati Ieronimi ...; Matheus &c. Prologus iste diuiditur in duas partes ...; Liber generationis I. C. Euangelium secundum Matheum diuiditur in duas partes

(fol. 129) Facies leonis a dextris ipsorum quatuor Eze 1. Secundum quod dictum fuit in principio euuangelii secundum Matheum ...; Marchus euuangelista. Euuangelio Marci beatus Ieronimus premittit prologum istum ...; Initium sancti euuangelii &c. Euuangelium secundum Marchum in 2 partes diuiditur
(fol. 140 Rom.) Ecce descripsi eam tripliciter Prou. 22. Quod uerbum de sapientie descripcione ...; Paulus uocatus apostolus. Hec epistola diuiditur in 3 partes
(fol. 159v I Cor.) Paulus ...; Hic incipit secunda epistolarum Pauli apostoli in qua incipit scribere Grece
(fol. 182 II Cor.) Paulus ...; Postquam apostolus scripsit Corinthiis instruens eos de sacramentis
msItem.explicit: Explicit postilla fratris Nicholai de Lira super epistolas ad Corinthos. Et finitur anno Domini millesimo CCC. XX nono.

msItem.explicit: Gratia domini nostri I. C. cum omnibus nobis amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit postilla super Apocalypsin et super totam bibliam edita a fratre Nicholao de Lira de ordine fratrum minorum sacre theologie doctore Deo gratias.
msItem.note: On fols. 255v-6v ‘Questiones fratris Nicholai de Lira in postillis suis super Biblia’, beg. ‘Vtrum Apocalypsis conuenienter ponitur ultimus in canone cum tamen scribitur ante euuangelium’. fol. 257rv blank.
Pr. Rome 1472 &c.; Glorieux, Théol. 345f; Stegmüller, Bibl. 5898, 5900, 5896–7, 5902–15, 5901, 5916–23. fol. 79v, between Joh. and Matt., blank.

supportDesc.extent:
324 leaves (iv + 320) 380 235
300 170
The edges retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A4, 1–212, 36, 4–612, 712 (+ 1 after 12), 8–2112, 2210, 2320, 24–612, 278(5 canc.); catchwords in frames which are sometimes patterned.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 66 lines. Most of fol. iv excised.

handDesc.handNote: To fol. 256v the hand of MSS 163–4; the remainder in a similar but later-looking anglicana hand. The first hand does running heads in capitals.

decoDesc.decoNote: Blue initials flourished in red, the first on fol. 1 with 1-sided border in the colours; red underlining.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired and rebacked; formerly chained from the usual position. The first and last leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding. Near the foot of fol. 324 are the marks of the large iron chain-staple. Formerly two straps from the front board to clasps at the back. On fol. 320 are the marks of pins in an earlier back board.

history.provenance: Part of a set with MSS 163–4.
Near the foot of the last leaves are the marks of the large iron chain-staple.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with contents and ‘F. 7, 8’ (canc.), s. xvii, and ‘O. 6. 5. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘K. 3. 5 (CLXV)’ in red; the College bookplate.
